title: Routledge Encyclopedia of Philosophy 10 Vol.
description:
Routledge Encyclopedia of Philosophy 10 Volumes

Edward Craig

Routledge 1998 | ISBN-10: 0415187060 | 9170 Pages | PDF | 50,7 MB








In this 10-volume set, we have a truly global encyclopedia of metaphysical thought--not just philosophy, but theology as well. Although it has noticeable British and American sensibilities, the Routledge Encyclopedia of Philosophy is a multicultural affair with over 2,000 individual articles, including entries for Cheng Hao and Baal Shem Tov along with RenÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â© Descartes and Immanuel Kant, and it discusses Mahayana Buddhism as ably as it discusses deconstruction theory.


 Admirable efforts have been made by the individual contributors (all 1,300-plus of them) to maintain such clarity of presentation as to provide a sophisticated yet accessible intellectual primer that requires only a willingness to learn. This is the philosophic equivalent of the Oxford English Dictionary, doubling as an indispensable reference and a marvelously indulgent splurge.
